name: stolid
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a person) calm and not showing emotion or excitement : He's a very stolid, serious man. Synonym
impassive
(of a thing) not interesting or attractive: The college is a stolid-looking building with no lawn.
More examplesFewer examplesEven NASA's generally stolid engineers were impressed. a stolid sheriff's deputyHis teammates beseeched him to take a bow. Williams remained stolid.She comes across as stolid and bureacratic in her response.His investments have tended to be safe and stolid.With its stolid, drab exterior, the Center resembles a combat bunker.
